full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

**Collection, Codification, Validation and Filing of Statistical Records**

**Reference Number:** cb-358-46006151
**Solicitation Number:** 30004915
**Publication Date:** 2024-03-15
**Tender Closing Date:** 2024-04-09 14:00:00
**Expected Contract Start Date:** 2024-04-15
**Expected Contract End Date:** 2025-03-31

**Summary:**

The Government of Canada is seeking a contractor to collect, codify, validate, and file statistical records for Fisheries and Oceans Canada, Canadian Coast Guard. The contractor will be responsible for collecting and preliminary processing of forms, as well as ensuring compliance with instructions and corrections from the Chief, SLD, and Statistical Analysts in each area.

**Scope of Work:**

* Collection and preliminary processing of forms
* Validating and coding of forms
* Filing and storage of statistical records
* Ensuring compliance with instructions and corrections from the Chief, SLD, and Statistical Analysts

**Delivery Locations:**

* Sept-Îles, QC
* Gaspésie-Îles-de-la-Madeleine, QC
* Côte-Nord, QC

**Trade Agreements:**

* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* World Trade Organization-Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Security Requirements:**

* The contractor must hold a valid organization security clearance
* The contract is subject to the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA) and other applicable trade agreements

**Contact Information:**

* Manon Paulin, Specialist Procurement
* 438-468-3247
* DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca et Manon.Paulin@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

**Instructions to Bidders:**

* Bidders are advised to submit their proposals in either official language
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement
* Documents may be submitted in either official language
